meanings.sent1: After the battle, there was a quick pullback of the soldiers to regroup.
meanings.sent2: The company ordered a strategic pullback to reassess the situation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a funny pullback when it saw a tiny acorn rolling towards it.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden pullback from the conversation left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent5: The pullback of the waves revealed a hidden treasure on the shore.

meanings.definition: A decrease or reduction in value or price
meanings.sent1: Investors were concerned about the pullback in stock prices.
meanings.sent2: The pullback in housing prices made it a good time to buy a new home.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected pullback in candy prices delighted the children at the store.
meanings.sent4: The pullback in the value of the antique vase shocked the owner.
meanings.sent5: The pullback in the cost of groceries was a relief for many families.

meanings.sent1: The team experienced a pullback in their performance during the last quarter.
meanings.sent2: The pullback in sales was attributed to the recent market conditions.
meanings.sent3: The pullback in internet connection speed caused frustration among the users.
meanings.sent4: Her pullback in energy levels affected her ability to complete the task.
meanings.sent5: The sudden pullback in temperature caught everyone off guard.
